summary: The Department of Defense has about 108,000 active duty medical personnel who provide health care on the battlefield and in military hospitals and clinics across the nation. In 2021, DOD proposed reducing the number of military medical personnel by over 10,000. These reductions could make it harder for the military health system to provide quality care and could affect the cost of that care. But...
title: Defense Health Care: Additional Assessments Needed to Determine Effects of Active Duty Medical Personnel Reductions
